Package SuffixTree.Java

Class Context

  • java.lang.Object
    • SuffixTree.Java.Context
  • public class Context
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a context by a base vertex, a direction and and an offset.
    Base vertexThe end of the context is represented relative to the base vertex
    DirectionIf the end of the context is not the base vertex, then it is on some edge originating from the base vertex, and direction tells which edge that is
    OffsetWhen direction is used, offset tells how many symbols to go along the edge given by direction in order to get the context's last symbol

      Creates a new context.

      Returns the symbol list used to create the entire suffix tree

      Returns the offset of this context.
      int getSize()

      Returns the symbol list representation of this context.
      boolean hasDecodedSuffix()
      Returns a boolean value which is true if this context has decoded a suffix and which is false otherwise.
      protected boolean isContext​(int a)
      Returns a boolean value which is true if the extension of this context with the argument is a context and which is false otherwise.
      boolean isExtensionOf​(Context C)
      Returns a boolean value which is true if this context is an extension of the argument context and which is false otherwise.
      Context newContext​(int a)
      Returns a new context which extends this one with one symbol.
      void print​(java.lang.String indent)
      Produces a simple ascii print of the symbol list representing this context on sysout.

      • Context

        protected Context​(Vertex baseVertex,
                  int direction,
                  int offset,
                  java.util.ArrayList L)
        Creates a new context.
        Parameters:
        baseVertex - The context's base vertex
        direction - The direction from the base vertex toward the end of the context
        offset - The offset from the base vertex in the direction given by parameter "direction"
        L - The symbol sequence
